Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, Safe, Friendly, Helpful”
Reviews.Author: cgustaf
Reviews.Content: Despite the steep. winding staircase (a bit difficult with a large suitcase), our stay was lovely. The staff, especially Jacky, was at all times more than willing to help out with whatever we needed in terms of recommendations, suggestions for outings, and directions. The location couldn't be better (down the block from several trams, bus 197 to/from the airport, and a short walk to Vondel Park). The room was small, but clean, adequate and quiet, the beds comfortable, and the breakfast much better than we anticipated (lots of delicious fruit, an assortment of breads, croissants, and cereals, cheese, meat, and eggs). Our only complaints were that the bathroom could have used a few hooks on the walls, and the stairwell is due for a coat of paint and some new carpeting. All in all, we were quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jcardona15
Reviews.Content: Really simple to get to. Quick check in. Centrally located near Leidseplaine. I stayed in one of the single units, in which I had to share the shower and toilet with 2 other single units. I get a little creeped out sharing showers with strangers, but I managed to be the first to shower 2 out of the 3 mornings, so it wasn't too bad. Shower was tiny, but this is what I have come to expect in European hotels. The room itself was also small, but sufficient for my needs. It included a sink and a view of a tiny courtyard. To get to the room you had to descend a steep staircase, but it wasn't an issue for me. Wifi was included, but it was slow at times. Staff was very helpful and helped me plan some of my time. They sell tickets to the Van Gogh Museum, and it is highly recommended to purchase tickets for any of the museums to avoid the lines. They will also print out tix for you for the other museums. The breakfast was also very nice each morning. Their croissants were delicious. Also, because they are a green hotel, it is nice to know that they are minimizing their carbon footprint. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat and will book my next stay here as well!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: nugget00
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at Hotel La Boheme and we had a fabulous few days. The staff were REALLY great and very helpful, the location was really good & we walked everywhere, the breakfast was good and the hotel was very clean. We would stay again and would recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: leonie69
Reviews.Content: Location, cleanliness and service. Stayed 4 nights here and couldn't have asked for anything more. We had a triple room on the first floor which was spotlessly clean, very quiet and serviced daily. Breakfast was very nice. Location is just around the corner from many restaurants, trams and the bus to/from airport. Staff all speak excellent English and offer extra service such as tram tickets, museum passes and postage stamps all at cost price. You cannot go past this place, it is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Phillygirl3140
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a lovely stay at Hotel Boheme for a 5-day trip this spring. We were looking for a simple, affordable place with a great location, and that's what this is. Our room, a double on the top floor, was TINY. But it was clean and cozy. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the shower was hot - which is all we needed after long days of sightseeing (you can walk just about everywhere from here)! Breakfast is fresh and delicious. The staff was friendly and the environment could not have been more welcoming. For the price, it's hard to see how you could do better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bobwindy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included. It was modest but fresh. The cheeses and meats were delicious as were the breads and croissants. Coffee was very good. The hotel is located near the museum area so it's an easy walk to Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum or the Stedelijk Museum. We bought our museum tickets at the hotel, which let us bypass the museum box office ticket lines. The hotel was a good value for the money and if I go back to Amsterdam the La Boheme is where I'll stay. This is not a luxury hotel, but a great value and a really good vibe while you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kbcowichan
Reviews.Content: Thanks a bunch to the staff at La Boheme! You are wonderful. This is a great location, simple clean rooms, well priced, and yes, steep stairs. I had to giggle on our arrival as I had read many reviews about the stairs, and I thought what's the big deal. O.K. I get it now. The stairs are steep, get over it people, stay at the Marriott if you can't handle the stairs. Keep in mind this is a budget hotel. Rooms are small, amenities are few. The staff are excellent and accommodating ( they let us keep a bike, and excess luggage in the breakfast room overnight). This is an ideal place to stay if your in Amsterdam for a day or 2, for longer visits you may want something more comfortable. Location is superior, and easy to get to and from the airport using the bus. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, simple”
Reviews.Author: Janet K
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a luxury hotel, go down the street to the Marriott hotel. But, if you want a clean, comfortable place to stay in a fantastic location, this is it. The stairs are bad, but not impossible. The staff was so friendly and helpful it was unbelievable. Breakfast was simple but it was fresh, tasty, and plentiful. There's a little restaurant two doors down connected to the Melkweig. It is the best. Owned by Mary who is a delight. And no matter what Mimi says, she is not allowed to have cream from a saucer.

Reviews.Title: “I bet you can find better options!”
Reviews.Author: vinivito
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, easy acces to and from the airport, good breakfast, room size is ok, but the pros stop there. The hotel is not very clean, hair on the sheets, dust on the surfaces, during the 4 days I was there they didnt change my sheets, when usualy you expect new sheets every 2 days (and I did ask them to do so on the 3rd day, but they didnt). The single rooms do not have bathroom, you have to share toilet and shower with other 2 rooms, which is very inconvenient, especially because they dont clean it every day, it seems that they only take the trash out, and thats it. There was a dirty towel from other guest that stayed on the floor of the shower for at least 2 days. Also no amenities, no soap, shampoo, etc. You dont even get a bath mat and the floor on the shower area is always very wet. Also staff is not friendly. Different from other small hotels I stayed during my trip, it seems they do not love what they do, but they do it only for the money. When you check in, the first thing they say is " you have to pay for your stay in advance and there is a 20 euros deposit for the room key" in instead of "how was your trip?" or something like that.. Also on my last night I asked for a plate with something to eat in the morning, since I was going to leave early and the breakfast starts only at 8:15 (breakfast is included). The lady at the front desk said "ok, but you will have to wait until the end of my shift" which was at 23:00, because thats when she was going to set up breakfast for the next morning. The thing is I had to wake up at 5:00, so I wanted to sleep early, I dont really get why she couldnt do it before, as she was not busy and it would take her 2 min to put some bread, cheese and ham on a plate. So I waited, and as if it was not enough, she didnt want to give me the kettle to boil water for coffe only because it was too hard to find, she didnt want to look for it. I do not recommend Hotel La Boheme and I bet you can find a better place to stay in Amsterdam for the same price..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruby R
Reviews.Content: If you're coming to Amsterdam from Schiphol airport, the location of La Boheme is absolutely perfect. The bus coming from the airport stops at the next corner, so even if you have big luggage, it's not a problem to take it like 50m to the hotel door (though, it's true that the staircase is steep and very narrow in the hotel, but that wasn't any problem for us young travelers :) Museumplein is just a 10-minute walk from there. Oh well, actually any touristic spot that was on my "must-see" list was in walking distance. Only took the tram once when it was raining really heavy. The hotel is cozy and clean. I heard from my friends who previously traveled to Amsterdam that budget hotels aren't too good there. But La Boheme exceeded my expectations. The room was big enough and it had all the essential. What I liked was kind of an "anteroom" - when you open the door with the key, you aren't immediately in the room itself. There's some space where you can leave coats, shoes, umbrellas (it was great to have that in humid January weather!) Then there's a second door that takes you to the room. I think it was also helpful to prevent any noise to be heard from the stairs. Kudos to the friendly hotel staff (including Mimi the cat!) When we arrived, we had a small problem with the shower. Even though it was Christmas eve, the hotel manager did everything she could to fix that asap. What else did I not cover yet... Oh yeah, breakfast was nice. So, to sum it up - a good place to stay when you travel in Amsterdam. This 2-star hotel was way better than some 3-star ones I stayed in some other European cities.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I'd known about La BohÃ¨me years ago!”
Reviews.Author: lupinofan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by a happy accident - the accommodation where I was meant to be staying had a problem, which left me scouring Trip Advisor's reviews section in a blind panic trying to find somewhere to stay. And it really WAS a happy accident. La BohÃ¨me is a clean, friendly and professionally-run hotel. Everybody I spoke to on reception was great - Jacky even indulged me while I told her the saga of how I'd bought a money bank for my nephew only to break it when it fell off my knee on the tram back to the hotel! (I bought a replacement.) The breakfasts were superb (although I think I needed the stairs to work off the damage done by warm, fluffy croissants first thing in the morning.) Talking of warm and fluffy, I should also mention Mimi. Mimi, I'm sure, owns the hotel - everybody else is merely her staff. She's a very affectionate tabby cat and I must confess was the unique selling point that convinced me to stay here. No problems with the room either (room 12, third floor, fifty stairs.) The wardrobe built-in between the front door and the bedroom door, opposite the bathroom, is an ingenious way of maximising a small space. Somebody else mentioned grey towels - I'm pleased to report I had no such problem. I've stayed in everything from the most basic holes right up to five-star hotels over the years, many of them in Amsterdam, and I have to say La BohÃ¨me has that indefinable "something" (probably a never-too-much-trouble attitude from the staff) which ensures that I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, cheery staff and brilliant accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Katherine B
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be rated at least 3 Stars, the 2 stars doesn't do this lovely hotel justice! After a cancelled flight and delays getting to Amsterdam, we couldn't have been been more happier with the accommodation. VERY comfortable beds!! To the point that they're too comfy and you don't want to get up! Lovely, bright, clean and comfortable rooms. Service impeccable. We stayed in the three bed room which had an ensuite which I know is quite rare in hotels in Amsterdam under 4 stars. Lovely breakfast and happy atmosphere in the hotel, which made our long weekend all that more enjoyable! I've recommended to all my family and friends this hotel as it is just perfect. Brilliant location, it is in Leidesplein but just far away from the noise to get a decent sleep, and also crucially for us, very close to the Museum quarter, with a pretty walk into The Dam. You can buy museum tickets in the hotel so you don't have to queue at the museums which is a bonus, and the breakfast is served at decent times in the morning (from 8.15 to 11!, possibly because the beds are so comfy!) Thank you very much Hotel La Boheme and we will be back! :) Katherine, Katie and Jessie from Oxford, UK

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: almalik78
Reviews.Content: great service, unbelivble location. right on Leidseplein, walking distanse to all major atractions in amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: collierje
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near Leidseplein which means tons of restaurant and bar options. There are also several coffeeshops not too far away. The hotel itself is clean, and the service is top notch. You can buy museum tickets and public transportation tickets from the front desk and save yourself some time. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for something cheap but safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Psquared2012
Reviews.Content: La Boheme was a great place to stay for a 2 star, and the rating reflects that. The staff were awesome, so very helpful. The room was tidy and compact, no frills, but I wasn't expecting any. I was pleasantly surprised that they did consider some key items - a safe in the room, RFID key fob for after hours access, a simple TV for down time, and WiFi access which is essential (ok I knew the WiFi would be there so it wasn't a surprise, just wanted to point it out). Also, I can't say enough about how great the location was. Leidseplein is a great place to stay in Amsterdam in my opinion. The neighborhood is somewhat a party district, but it's also close to the trams, the museums, and good shopping in the nine streets area. My only complaint that I hope they will address is that the mattress pad (between the mattress and the sheet) looked like it had not been washed in some time, if ever. Obviously the sheets were very clean and nice, just the state of the pad was a little disappointing. Also, the mattress was a little saggy, but I slept just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Fi-kat
Reviews.Content: La Boheme is a lovely and welcoming hotel. Staff are friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. Checking in is a breeze and includes a 'walk-through' of a map of the city and sights. Our room was on the top floor (4th) and it was tiny and cramped but very clean, well-equipped and perfectly adequate for people who don't spend a lot of time in their room. The only downside was that the free Wifi was never strong enough to work in our room (top floor, #16). We mentioned it to staff, who said it would be looked into. It was not fixed while we were there but I have no doubt it will be because it's obvious management care and take issues seriously. Instead of having Wifi in the room, we had to always use the Wifi in the dining/bar/reception, which was fine because there you get the added extra of friendly staff and cat. The daily breakfast is typically Dutch - it's superb, with plenty of choice and beautifully fresh. We can highly recommend La Boheme. It ticks all the right boxes for a great value hotel in the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect for what it is”
Reviews.Author: BigTA
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. A basic room at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Irnbru4ever
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location at Leidseplein where you can walk all over town. In fact there is a direct bus from the airport (197) every 20 minutes nearly to the door. The staff are all really friendly and there is a lovely bar with snacks. The rooms are a little basic but the prices are competitive in a very expensive city. I stayed with family and we had a triple room on the 1st floor. The beds were narrow and the room looked a little spartan but everything worked well (wifi, heating, bathroom) and the beds were comfy. The shower was great and adjustable for even a tall Dutchman (unfortunately we didn't have one with us). Some of our party stayed in a double room on the 5th floor - this is a big climb with luggage as there is no lift, and they said the wifi didn't work as well up there, but they were comfy nonetheless. The breakfast was one of the best I've had anywhere - homemade hot croissants, tasty rye bread and peppery cheese amongst the treats, with lattes to order. We had a fab time and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: A nice warm friendly hotel on a cold February weekend. Everyone else has written all you need to know. It's a lovely clean, cheap place to stay. Even better the triple rooms actually have 3 single beds would recommend it to anyone who can deal with the steep narrow stairs

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LDNlaker
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a great part of the city. I have been to Amsterdam several times and I wish I'd found Hotel La Boheme sooner! Amsterdam is expensive and this hotel is the best value for money I have found. Staff members (including Mimi the cat!) are friendly and helpful, the location is excellent, breakfast is tasty (typically Dutch, nice and fresh) and rooms are very clean, bright and comfortable. I slept better than I do at home! I will stay here again and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Amazing Location, Low Price!”
Reviews.Author: Coops27
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel La Boheme for three nights at the beginning of january. Despite the weather being MUCH colder than we had expected, the hotel room was always nice and warm. The beds were so comfortable and the room was clean and big enough for the two of us. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was simple but plenty to choose from. Location was fantastic, we walked EVERYWHERE from the hotel. Nothing was more than a 20 minute walk maximum. I would definitely recommend this hotel, the value for money was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: Very good small hotel in great location. Nice and friendly staff, and comfortable rooms. Easy acces to the city... Maybe not the luxury but pleasant comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sergio D
Reviews.Content: The staff is really great, the rooms are clean, and the bathroom is OK as well. The location is great, about 1 minute walking to Leidseplein, from which you can take several trams/buses to everywhere. You can also walk from there to any other interesting location in the city. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: The staff at La Boheme were the extremely friendly and helpful, it made for a wonderful stay. The rooms were very clean and big, and the beds were great. Perfect location for being able to easily access Amsterdam, without having to be kept up every night by the red light district. This is probably the best value for money hotel that we stayed at in our three months traveling through western Europe. Looking forward to coming back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms run down, but location and service top notch”
Reviews.Author: Whitna85
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located near Leidseplein, one of the main bar/food areas. Just a 3 minute walk from the tram stop. It is on a main street, so if you have a room facing that way you will hear the tram go by often and many people on the streets. GREAT value for the location. But our double room was tired and worn down. We stayed in November 2011 and I've read that some rooms may have been updated, but ours was not. I would check with hotel before booking to ensure a newer room. Staff was so friendly and like all Dutch people, spoke perfect English. Breakfast was small, but adequate. Good service at breakfast made up for the lack of options. I would stay here again for the value in Amsterdam and the location to everything you want to do and see. We walked everywhere :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Terry_and_Eric
Reviews.Content: Lovely, clean and recently renovated Hotel. Great location. And, the staff are amazing! We arrived at 8:30 am and they made every effort to get us in our room early. Meanwhile, waiting in the cafe with delicious coffee made our day. The breakfast is delicious. Staff are very knowledgeable about Amsterdam and will go out of their way to assist you with tickets and bus passes. The bus to and from the airport stops on the corner, takes just 30min and costs only 4 Euros. Wonderful movie theatre across the street and within 15 minutes you can walk to any site in Amsterdam. Enjoy your stay here. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Contagiously happy staff”
Reviews.Author: Megan M
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the location was perfect. WiFi was reliable. Breakfast was consistently good, fresh, and plentiful. The staff was helped us research details of where we wanted to go and things we wanted to see in Amsterdam and also made great recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: DontShootFood
Reviews.Content: We arrived half an hour before our allocated check-in time, but our room was available and so they let us check in early, which was a lovely touch. Mimi the cat was taking a break, the weather was quite cold and she had decided to hide behind the reception computer where it was nice and warm! Our room was on the top floor, and the stairs are just as steep as everyone keeps saying. The room itself was small but functional, though the chair in the bathroom between the sink and angled roof was a curious addition - I'm quite skinny but was completely unable to make use of it! The bed was really comfortable, the room was warm, breakfast was fine, the staff were all lovely (and being able to take a couple of guidebooks from reception to our room was great), and while we took a slightly awkward route to get to the hotel, once you get your bearings and start to learn the city you realise how well-located the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kstar4
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at La Boheme for 3 days. The rooms were sunny and clean, the beds were very comfortable, and the breakfasts were delicious. The best part was the staff at the front desk - they were very warm, friendly and helpful and gave great tips on places to visit and eat. Try out De Koe for dinner/drinks just down the road! Highly recommend La Boheme.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, friendly staff, fun stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: Perfect base to explore the city from. Friendly and helpful service, breakfast was included in our stay which was a pleasant surprise and the room was more than adequate for our short stay. Some nice local amenities and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: GiseleNMendez
Reviews.Content: At Hotel La BohÃ¨me we've found the nicest staff we've met so far since we began our journey: smiley and super helpful, always offering directions and recommendations that were really useful. And the location was just perfect: a block away from Leidseplein! Walking distance from the city centre, the flower market and Museumplein. A tram away from the Red Lights District and Dam Square (we just walked to those two spots as well so you don't need the tram but it's a nice touch). The breakfast was really good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LINDSAY H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last Sunday & Monday. Loved the location, we chose it as its a couple of doors away from the Melkweg club that we were going to on Sunday night. First impression is great as the entrance, reception/breakfast room & downstairs loo have had a make-over which the rest of the Hotel would benefit from. Staff are very friendly & helpful, and they do have a lovely cat! We stayed in room 16 at the top which is the smallest double room we have ever stayed in. It was very clean, warm, very comfortable bed and quiet, but some of the towels do need replacing as they are a bit grey. You have to collect TV remote from reception, and pay a 20 euro deposit for the room key. Buffet breakfast is served ' till 11.00. As other reveiwers have said, the staircase is very steep and narrow, not a problem for us, but could be for some. Hotel Staff tip - Schipol Airport bus No.197 is across the road outside the America Hotel, runs every 15 mins, 4 euros, takes 1/2 hour - brilliant! We enjoyed our stay here, it suited us perfectly- it just felt overpriced -but then you are really paying for the location not the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, good breakfast, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: timpitts57
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in every way. The location is unbeatable, a block from Leidseplein. The hotel is nice and clean, with a big bar and reception area where breakfast is served. My room was decently roomy for Amsterdam, and the bathroom was also a good size. The room was clean and had a window that opened, a TV with English channels, and a telephone, plus a big closet. Plenty of room for clothes. Breakfast was good, a nice variety of breads, cheeses, eggs, coffee, etc. Very friendly staff. I loved it. Beware of very steep steps. Take the bus from the airport. I am always leery of taking a bus from the airport, but it was super-easy, cheap, and dumps you out right at Leidseplein, a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: milligan1959
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 night stay at La Boheme for 1st December. We arrived a little while before the check in time as Amsterdam was not being kind to us with the weather. Our room was ready and we checked in to room 15 on the 3rd floor. The room overlooked Marnixstraat and the DelLaMar Theatre. The room was of adequate size for the two of us with a king size bed, table, wardrobe, bedside table and TV. The bed linen was spotlessly clean as were the bathroom towels. The room was decorated to a high standard, all the carpets and fittings were well cared for, the bathroom although small was very clean. The room had a radiator and was nice and warm. Free Wi-fi is available for all visitors and worked fine, a laptop is available free for use in the reception area. As the hotel points out to travellers/visitors the stairs to the rooms are steep and may not be suitable for the less mobile. Breakfast is taken in the main reception area and a very good selection is provided, tea and coffee is made fresh for each visitor. There was a choice of cereals, fresh fruit, fruit juices, yogurt, toast, boiled eggs, meats and cheeses, along with a selection of cakes. The seating area and tables were fresh and very clean. La Boheme is well situated for all the main attractions in Amsterdam and everything is in easy walking distance. There is a regular tram service along Marnixstraat should the weather make walking a problem. Mimi is a very friendly and vocal cat who loves to make people welcome as they enter reception. Our stay at La Boheme was very pleasant and we would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam, if we return in the future we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: FlÃ¡via Y
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Clean rooms, quiet, friendly staff and a delicious breakfast. If that's not enough, the location is excellent. Oh, and Mimi the cat is oh so sweet. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for an affordable hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bocadey
Reviews.Content: By the standards of other major European tourist cities (Paris, Venice, Barcelona), Hotel La Boheme would be considered spartan, somewhat uncomfortable, and a bit dingy. However, hotels in Amsterdam are expensive, and La Boheme offers a lot of value and convenience at an affordable cost. You couldn't ask for a better location. It's right in the heart of the action, seconds away from the Leidseplein and minutes from Spuistraat, but the hotel off to the side a little, so it's quiet around the hotel. The stop for the airport bus is around the corner. The hotel offers a tasty organic breakfast every morning until 11 am, including cereals, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, breads, local cheeses and freshly brewed coffee. The staff is definitely helpful and informative, although we didn't find them as outgoing and friendly as other reviewers. We really appreciated the hotel's eco-conscious efforts, including the use of green energy and an internal recycling program. We stayed in a room on the top floor. No one's kidding about the hike up the narrow, twisty stairs to get to the rooms. We were tired on our arrival and after hauling our bags up to the room, we set out to explore the city. Unfortunately, we kept forgetting things we wanted to bring along, so we had to trek back up and down a couple of times. That was a good way to work off the Gouda we consumed. The room itself was airy, although it didn't have much storage space for luggage and clothes. The furnishings and decor were a touch drab. There was a small TV and a working phone. The bathroom was surprisingly large (almost half the size of the room), but the shower was tiny and the water pressure was inconsistent. One evening it suddenly spurted mid-shower and flooded the bathroom floor. One of us has visited Amsterdam several times in the past, including some business trips, and compared the hotel favorably to other hotels and B&B's in Amsterdam. As a safe and clean base for exploring the city, Hotel La Boheme cannot be beat. Unless you're willing to splurge on a four-star hotel, this is as good as it gets in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, convenient, and friendly. Not fancy, VERY steep stairs, and the bathroom was dark and damp. But the bed (top floor) was large and clean. The location is excellent, near many bars and restaurants. The bus to the airport (197) leaves from across the street. I would stay here again. The staff was helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated but still charming”
Reviews.Author: HerzliyaWolf
Reviews.Content: La Boheme is a two-star hotel with no frills. Good stuff: The staff are charming, they have a cute cat (Mimi) who is their mascot, and hangs around the checkin-counter. The "lobby" has a bar and tables facing the street window, and they serve nice beers there in the evening. The room was extremely clean, and it was very quiet (facing the back). The location is excellent; so easy to get to by bus from the airport, and the tram and bus stops are right there. Not-so-good stuff: No shampoo, no little extras. I had to leave very early for the airport, and they did give me some tea and bread with cheese to take up to my room for the morning, but it was only after I asked, and kind of pressed for it. The beds were too soft; they sank a bit in the middle. The stairs are VERY VERY STEEP, so if you hate climbing stairs, don't even think about it. I think it's way over-rated in Tripadvisor, but is still a reasonable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Olga V
Reviews.Content: Great location and very friendly staff! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff, simple rooms, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Dean L
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Amsterdam, making basically everything within walking distance. Excellent bars/cafes/shops within walking distance. Tram stop nextdoor too. Room was basic and good value. Hotel staff were excellent and genuinely friendly. Special mention goes to jackie and alice. Room was generally pretty clean. Carpet looked old. There were some mosquitoes oustside the rooms in the hallways/stairwells, as well as a dead one on the wall inside the room (??).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, mixed feelings about the room”
Reviews.Author: Allie H
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at Hotel La Boheme and enjoyed my stay. The hotel's location was great and the staff was very friendly. The room was clean although I personally found the carpet floor a little off-putting. I also wasn't a fan of the narrow and winding staircase which made me nervous every time I climbed it. The temperature of the shower also was erratic and the water would switch from cold to hot rather unexpectedly. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget but I don't know if I'd stay here next time I go to Amsterdam. The accommodations were fine but we were not completely thrilled with our room. The central location is definitely a major plus though.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position and lovely host”
Reviews.Author: richard w
Reviews.Content: boys weekend away, nice and clean, really friendly host and really good breakfast, will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: LilyRose042
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently with friends and it was perfect hotel for us- the room was clean and comfortable. We basically only slept and had a shower there and then went out and just wanted something clean, basic and in a good location - this fitted the bill. The location is perfect - we walked everywhere - to all the museums, shops and up to the red light district. If you are interested in a weekend of sex, drugs and rock and roll I would say this hotel is not for you - they have a strict no smoking (cigarettes I think) and no drugs policy. I would say if this is what you're after then stay closer to the red light district. This policy suited us perfectly though. The pubs and clubs around the hotel are really cool- they are open late and have a lot of Dutch people in which gives you a bit more of an authentic experience and means prices of local drinks/beer are good value. We went to Melkweg nightclub and it was great, I'd recommend going and it is literally round the corner. I didn't notice any pub noise to be honest, just a bit of tram noise in the morning but it wasn't noisy at all especially for somewhere so central. The stairs are quite steep and narrow, (I think this is typical of the architecture though) but that was no problem and I'm not the fittest and was on the top floor and had no problems! Breakfast was nice - staff friendly if you needed advice with directions. When you arrive you get a map with some money off some attractions. The breakfast was also on until 11, which I thought was pretty good. Also the bus to the airport is right by the fountain near the hotel and only cost 4 euros, and took about 30mins. In summary I would definitely recommend staying as excellent value for money/clean/comfortable/great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MacBee85
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying in this hostel if you are visiting Amsterdam. It is very central with plenty of clubs and pubs around it and close to all major attractions eg Van Gough museum. It was very clean, breakfast was lovely and the staff really made us feel welcome and at home. You can get a bus to and from the airport outside the hostel. We all would definitely stay here again when we re-visit Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, value and staff.”
Reviews.Author: FatherDoo
Reviews.Content: We had no need to use public transport from this excellent base for sightseeing and soaking up the atmosphere in autumnal Amsterdam; everywhere's in walking distance. Staff are welcoming, friendly and helpful. Triple room had three comfortable single beds and en-suite WC and shower - all very clean. Very good range of food at breakfast to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: ogtrv
Reviews.Content: The staff at La Boheme could not have been more friendly and helpful! They always had time to help guests, even during the busy breakfast period, at a time when the hotel was full. The location is very great, close to the Leidseplien, with its many restruants (...but also turn right as you leave the hotel for a excellent eat cafe...which sadly we only found on our last night). It also close to the museum quarter and offers musuem tickets to jump the queues. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the continental breakfast offered the usual variety, plus a gorgeous fruit loaf...and you can go back for seconds and thirds! The stairs are steep, but you get used to them! However, this is something to consider if elderly or in ill health We have recommended the hotel to friends and if returning to Amsterdam, would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “La Boheme - a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Stan_And_Jan_G
Reviews.Content: We chose La Boheme mainly because it was opposite the De La Mar Theatre where we wanted to see Janis Ian, but really pleased that we did. We saw four different staff members manning the reception during our stay and they were all very friendly and helpful. It was a good example of Amsterdam Hotels, including the high narrow stairs that some mention. Unless you are not very steady on your feet or you prefer to stay in a bland, modern high-rise type hotel, this is not a problem. This is Amsterdam with high narrow buildings - its part of the charm. Our room was clean and efficient and the breakfast was more than adequate. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully friendly staff, great breakfast, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Zachary_Glazer
Reviews.Content: The front-desk staff at this hotel were SO genuinely welcoming and friendly; it was the perfect first place to stay after arriving in Europe. The hotel's location about a block away from Leidseplein is ideal for exploring the canal ring, the Jordaan, and Museumplein, and for catching trams to elsewhere in the city. Proximity to the noise and traffic of Leidseplein isn't an issue, since La BohÃ¨me is located on a quiet section of the adjacent Marnixstraat. Our room was a triple, which we took because all the doubles were booked, and the room definitely felt a little cramped with all the furniture. We ended up moving the beds around to make more space, and it worked just fine, but it would have been pretty crowded with three people. I don't think you can really expect spacious hotel rooms in Amsterdam, so it wasn't a problem for us for a two-night stay, but it might've gotten to us if we'd stayed there a week. Breakfast was a tasteful array of high-quality meats, cheeses, bread, fruit, muesli, yogurt, coffee and tea, and the lobby/eating area was a relaxing place to start the day. The bathroom in our room was typically compact, but everything worked flawlessly: great water pressure and plenty of hot water. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: smf2050
Reviews.Content: I have just checked out today. The hotel room was nothing special but the bed was comfortable, the tv was fine and who wants to stay in the room anyway. Very friendly and helpful staff. This hotel for the price is spot on

Reviews.Title: “A quaint hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph T
Reviews.Content: If you have been to Amsterdam, you know that hotels are very expensive. Hotel La Boheme is a great value with a wonderful location. I booked a triple room for myself, brother and sister-in-law. The room consisted of 3 single beds, a closet, night stands and private bathroom. We were in room 6, which is one level up from the main entrance. The hotel does not have air conditioning and our room faced the main street. Even with the windows open, the noise level was not bad considering we were there last week when Europe was experiencing some unusually warm weather. There is no elevator and the climb to the upper rooms is steep. The beds were comfortable and they offer a great breakfast. The staff was exceptional and very helpful in answering questions about the city. The best part is that they sell transit passes and museum passes. Buy at the hotel and save the time in the lines! The hotel is 1/2 block to the Leidseplein along with the 197 bus to/from the airport. Bus fare to/from the airport is about 4E. Be careful on when you arrive. If you arrive really early in the morning like we did, hang out at the airport and have breakfast. Reception opens at 0830 and rooms are available after 1300. If you arrive early, the staff will hold your bags until your room is available. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jaana K
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good location. Very friendly staff. Nice breakfast. All main tourist actractions are within walking distance. Many nice restaurants in neigborhood, e.g. Klos (great ribs!). Easy to take a bus from airport to Leidseplein (cost 4 â‚¬). The room was small but big enough for 2 persons for sleeping. The room was clean, and luckily we got a room from the backside since the street was very noisy during the weekend. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Quintus_Willemse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situted centrally with all tourist actractions within walking distance. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean. The breakfast is also very good and value for money! Will definately stay her again in future!! The bus to the airport (#197) leaves from the front of the American hotel, a minute walk away and only cost 4 Euro on way.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worsest hotel in Amsterdam I've ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: DapperBali
Reviews.Content: There was a smell of coffeshop in the sheets, hygene is not the best here. In front the rooms are noisy. Service was not so good. It seems that this hotel is going down in quality the last months..

Reviews.Title: “Great spot especially if travelling by yourself”
Reviews.Author: livefortravelchick
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a great location with great staff!! Travelling around by myself and everything about it is just too easy and not a bit intimidating. Lovely staff (who might perhaps be a little cat obsessed), it's an easy place to hang out at small little cafe/bar by yourself, clean rooms....perfect for a wknd. they say 2 star but its prob a 3.5 and also prob priced similar to a 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: TommyTV
Reviews.Content: We needed a reasonably priced hotel for one night prior to a Baltic Cruise, and the reviews on Tripadvisor guided us in the right direction. I'd emailed ahead that we were a 'mature' couple so a room on a lower floor would be appreciated, and we got a prompt reply back saying it was no problem, and the staff would help us getting the cases up the very steep stairs. The Hotel is very near to a main bus route from the airport - 197 I think, and as it only costs 4 Euros it's a lot cheaper than a Taxi. It takes about 30 minutes on the bus, and we used this route again at the end of our Cruise so we could get back into Amsterdam for some sightseeing, as our flight back to Manchester was quite late in the afternoon. The hotel's location is absolutely ideal, being in Leidseplien which has lots of bars, cafe's and shops. Everything of interest to us was within walking distance, and the Hotel has discounted tickets for the museums which allowed you to walk in without queueing, which I would highly reccomend. Both the Reiks Museum and the Van Goch Museum are within easy walking distance, as are canal boat tours and the Vondel Park. Bearing in mind the two star rating, the hotel was quite compact, however the staff went out of thier way to be helpful and informative. The room was quite small but had an en-suite (small) bathroom that was absolutely spotless with fresh towels each day. The beds were very comfortable but there is no air conditioning so we slept with the large window slightly ajar as it was extremely warm. Our room overlooked the front of the hotel, and the street outside was quite lively with passing pedestrians, but it was a Friday night so not unexpected. Breakfast was excellent buffet style so you could eat as much as you wanted. As we weren't due to board the ship till 1p.m., we left out luggage in reception for collection later. They gave us a security ticket to ensure no one else could take them, which I thought was a nice idea. All in all, not 5 star luxury but ideal for those on a budget who want somewhere ideally located and extremelly clean and secure. I would highly reccomend this Hotel on those criteria. Martin

Reviews.Title: “Awesome B&B in great location”
Reviews.Author: rBerry10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and it surpassed expectations by miles. Welcoming staff on arrival and very helpful. As it was our first visit to Amsterdam, they recommended what we could do to maximise our Amsterdam experience! Very relaxed atmosphere from the place. We stayed in a 3 person room with an extra mattress for 4 people in total. Room was a good size, with the extra mattress on the floor it was cosy. Very clean and tidy with all the essentials needed for a great stay. Excellent music choice in the bar/reception area too! To emphasise how accommodating the staff are, the lock on the door had broken which meant staff had to sleep in the reception area at night so that when people staying arrived at the door, the staff would let them in. EVEN at 5am. Great hospitality, cannot be beaten. Excellent stay and will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly”
Reviews.Author: Gabriella1984
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for sightseeing, walking distance to pretty much everything! Super friendly staff, with lots of good tips on what to see & do. Pretty small rooms, but clean & very comfortable beds and good closet space! We defintely recommend this hotel, and hope to get back to lovely Amsterdam some day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best bet for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: kurikomagirl
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget in Amsterdam, this is the place to stay! Great location, comfy beds, clean, free breakfast...all in all a cozy home away from home.....no complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: philipkendall
Reviews.Content: third year running at this hotel,says it all...location,staff,cleanliness,breakfast...all excellent

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel; Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: I_Hilton
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Amsterdam. My flight arrived quite early and I was unable to check in until around 1400 hrs., although this was not a problem as the hotel allowed me to store my luggage until that time, which allowed me to explore the city while I waited. One thing I especially liked was that upon check-in Majel said "no surprises" in regards to pricing, and she was exactly right. Yes, the stairs are steep, that's common in Amsterdam - get over it. The location is especially great for Van Gogh, Reiks, and Vondelpark, that said; I walked the entire city (in flipflops) from this location without any problems. Though for older folks it might present a bit of a trek. My room was great for the price and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and polite. The only downsides (for me) would be distance from the RLD, and that the map at the desk was a bit odd in the sense that true North was askew, and the street names were slightly difficult to decipher. All that said for the price you probably cannot find a better hotel in Amsterdam. A great staff in a clean hotel located in the heart of the Leidesplein.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, basic room but great staff”
Reviews.Author: escargot222
Reviews.Content: The staff at La Boheme are all fabulous, and the welcome is warm. They couldn't be more helpful, which made up for the very average room. The simple buffet breakfast is good. You can use their computer for 30 minutes per day to check emails - a wonderful service - and even print boarding passes on their printer. The location is easy to get to from the station by tram (too far to walk) and perfect for visiting the major museums. Let's face it, hotels in Amsterdam are expensive and booked out way in advance (as we discovered some time back), so we had to pay a lot more for our accommodation here than in other large cities. La Boheme was perfectly acceptable but felt a bit like being in school camp when it came to the room and the facilities. We had to pay for the whole stay on arrival, before even seeing the room, and were then asked for a 20 euro key deposit (in cash). Hair dryers were given out on request by reception but had to be returned once you had finished with them. The beds were a bit saggy and had seen better days, same for the towels which were a bit ragged, and the decor was basic. The tiny old TV was missing its antenna so the reception was lousy. There is no lift and the stairs are steep and narrow, which was fine for us but would not suit everyone. However all in all it did the job, and we'd stay here again if our top choices were once again booked out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near everything with great price and great personal”
Reviews.Author: erral
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in august 2011 and we liked the hotel very much. The price was excelent and the situation perfect in Leidseplein. The personal of the hotel was very great they asked all our questions and offered excelent service. The rooms were very-very clean and decorated in a modern-minimalistic way, the beds were perfect. We will accomodate again here if we come back to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen095
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel; the staff were fantastic, very helpful gave us lots of advice and tips. Booked tickets for us on line and printed them off. Buffet breakfast was great, plenty of everything Cereals, bread, eggs, cheese, meat, fruit, juice, tea, coffee. Hotel in great location, near Leidseplein close to Museums, shopping, lots of restaurants, cafÃ©s and the trams. Would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: tincze
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it's always the case, but when we visited Amsterdam was teeming with loud tourists, smoking and drinking(including marijuana). So it was nice to find this hotel which provided a clean and quiet and friendly atmosphere. Yes it had tiny rooms for around 100 euro, but that's Amsterdam, quite expensive. The morning breakfast was amazing, with organic eggs, milk, cereals, yoghurt, certainly not your typical "continental breakfast). The park and the city centre are a few blocks away. If we were to visit Amsterdam again(note: we won't), we'd stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel La Boheme, ausgezeichnet!”
Reviews.Author: blackdog51
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at La Boheme. The room (Room 4) was quiet with good ventilation. Mimi has quite a personality! The stairs were steep but, hey! This is Amsterdam. The price was reasonable considering this was high season. The breakfast buffet never let me down. I will definitely consider La Boheme for my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lupmann
Reviews.Content: I've booked the hotel since the rating was good and I must admit that it's true! The hotel is very cosy,the owners are very nice (also the cat MIMI!) and the room was clean. It's true that the stairs are steep (but if you haven't health problems I don't see too much difficulty). Breakfast was simple but you can have it as much as you like. Wi-Fi is free and each bathroom has it own shower. Not too far from the city centre: 10 min by tramway or 20 min by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for all Amsterdam tourist spots!”
Reviews.Author: millstreet11
Reviews.Content: My son wanted to go to Amsterdam for his stag party! I was not over impressed with the choice but the mix of young and "not so young" were perfectly treated by the staff of La Boheme. Slightly dodgy staircase(after a bit of the local cuisine!) but that apart, well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia83
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at La Boheme and were so pleased with our visit. The location was outstanding...you can walk just about anywhere from the hotel, and trams and buses are just around the corner. The rooms are nothing fancy and on the small side, but they are clean and comfortable (loved the bed!). As you may have read from other reviews, the stairs are no joke, but if you are healthy you should have no problem (I figured a little work out every time I went up to my room couldn't hurt!). The staff was fantastic, very friendly and helpful. The breakfast/reception area is also really great. You can pop in just about any time for a drink or to ask a question, and it was nice to look out the big windows every morning while enjoying the included breakfast! I really feel like you'd be hard-pressed to find a better value in Amsterdam as hotels in the city are quite expensive (believe me, I did the research!). The fact that breakfast and WiFi are included was the cherry on top. I will absolutely be recommending to friends who visit Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and very convenient, but quite small”
Reviews.Author: kimbaroni
Reviews.Content: Our stay at La Boheme was very pleasant. We would book again (at least in the fall/winter/spring - see below). Strong points: Despite its central location it's fairly quiet. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and they know their town well; they'll arrange tickets for you, they have info about transportation and attractions, and they're happy to answer questions. Breakfast is very good. The hotel is clean, well-equipped and secure. It has a friendly vibe that's reminiscent of the best youth hostels out there. (Tiny) weak points: Despite the fact that we live in Europe and we're used to non-air-conditioned spaces, we found this hotel to be quite warm. We stayed in the uppermost room, and it was pretty hot for June, to be fair, but it was definitely uncomfortable. For non-summer months, obviously this isn't an issue, but if you're traveling in the summer, you might want to keep this in mind. Wifi access up there was spotty, too. The rooms are small - I'm a small person, and still found it pretty tight. Many people have mentioned the stairs. Considering the dimensions of a typical house in Amsterdam, I didn't find them to be *that* unusual, but if you're new to the city, you should be aware that they are quite steep. If you have mobility issues, or are a big person, you may want to book a room close to the ground floor. Overall, I recommend La Boheme. It's not luxurious, but they have everything you need to have a pleasant stay, and you can tell that they really love what they do.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 Star hotel. Clean, convenient, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: W0w_Wanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rm 14, a triple for 3 nights. It was good size and allowed the 3 of us space to stow luggage. Then moved to Rm 16, a double when it was just 2 of us. A little smaller, but perfect for us. The rooms are of adequate size, and breakfast was decent with toast, cereal, fresh fruit, hardboiled eggs, juices and coffee/tea. Overall, it was a great experience and we found it easy to take the 197 bus from Schipol or train + tram from airport/Central station. Great location. only thing missing was hairdryer as we didn't have one in the bathroom. We didn't ask the front desk as we did have one. Something you might want to double check if you need one, but don't plan to travel with one.

Reviews.Title: “Been there ,and just booked again for more !!”
Reviews.Author: oziehenk
Reviews.Content: Service friendly and warm welcoming ,room exellent for one person , liked the basement position of room ,basic but comfortable amenities ,location in Amsterdam is exellent close to musea an nightlife

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, helpfull staff, would return”
Reviews.Author: male_1234
Reviews.Content: Well presented room in a quiet hotel. About 2 mins from lots of bars/restaurants but still really quiet at night (and our room was on the road side). Friendly service, nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: Janet-inPerth
Reviews.Content: La Boheme was excellent value for money, it is only rated 2 stars so we expected much worse. Staff all very helpful and friendly, breakfast included, one flight of stairs to negotiate but we travel light so easily carried our bags up the very narrow steep stairs (standard for here). We were able to leave our bags until the check in time. Buy daily transport passes at the Hotel, they also sell Musuem passes. Tip - if you like to save time and money; travel from the airport to La Boheme by the local bus 197 direct to Leidseplein not the train into Centraal and then tram back out to La Boheme. The bus leaves every 30 mins from the bus stand (Point 10), just past the taxi stand, as you exit the airport. The buses and trams list stop details onboard. Get off at Leidseplein and it is a short walk to Marnixstraat for La Boheme.

Reviews.Title: “I love it and I hope to be back”
Reviews.Author: CRISTIANE73
Reviews.Content: Great place and good price, close to most places that you want to see like museums and night life.

Reviews.Title: “6 Star Service, 5 Star Location, 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelissaKarnowski
Reviews.Content: When i first arrived at this Hotel i was swearing at the stairs and my choice for staying here. Even after reading the reviews online I didn't realize how steep those stairs were! Then I arrived at the room very average nothing really to report home about., but after staying here 3 nights the staff really changed my opinion about this hotel. They were all great and deserve a pat on the back! Pros - the friendliest, most helpful staff I have ever met and that is saying a lot! That is really what makes this place so great is the staff. Location could not be better, breakfast was really good and was included. Bike rental location is really close (ask staff they will tell you). Cons - mentioned previously but the service and location washed away all memories of the stairs and average room. ***The reason why i have gave this hotel a 5 star (instead of a 3 based solely off the room) is because for the price and service they deserve it! Traveler tip - RENT BIKES -There is no other way to get around this city. Trust me. Its the cheapest, easiest, most convenient way to travel and see the city. The bikers have right of way at all times if you are walking its more dangerous! **Also if you rented a car or arrived in Amsterdam by car they have a free park and ride location. Ask the staff about it, its only like 8 dollars a day to park your car and you get free transportation (bus or metro) there and back to pick up your car.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: catrick
Reviews.Content: after getting off the tram in leidseplein everything was going on around us . lots of streets and we were sure we were going to get lost . we walked round a corner and there it was . 1 mins walk out of the square. perfect . we were welcomed cheerily and after a delay that was lovely . we were offered so much useful advice and they were jsut lovely . we booked a top floor double room . it really was at the top . we thought wed struggle with the dutch stairs but once youve done it once its easy . the room was plenty big enough for 2 with a nice sized ensuite . the bed was amazingly comfy , comfy enough to ignore the fact your in dam and stay in bed :) the room was very clean aswell. breakfast is a nice variety of bread and cereal and cheese etc and its nice to watch all the bikes go past as your eating breakfast . all in all a very good hotel and i hope to come back soon

Reviews.Title: “La Boheme is a cosy home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Sparksy7
Reviews.Content: Please make sure you stay at this absolutely wonderful little hotel in Amsterdam. It is divine. OK ....there are a lot of stairs...but it's Amsterdam and that's how everything is there!! The staff are so friendly and helpful,(all of them) and the rooms are so clean and inviting. I had a room with 2 beds as I wanted to have my own bathroom and the beds were so comfy with lovely doonas. I had great night's sleep! They have a computer there for use by guests so that was really good not having to go to an Internet Cafe all the time. They give great suggestions of all things to do and offer this lovely breakfast included which is top class! I loved my stay here and would definitely go back there again. The location is perfect to get to see everything...close to Museum, shops and Canal cruises. They have this cute cat that just hangs out and gets pats from all the guests...It really is a lovely atmosphere here! So stop looking and book it....you will not do better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, friendly staff, superb location”
Reviews.Author: Candn2011
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted a few days in Amsterdam but we were on a tight budget so we picked this hotel because it seemed good value and was in a brilliant location. We were not disappointed. Staff were very welcoming and really friendly. Our room was basic but was clean, comfy and quiet which was surprising given the place backs onto Melkweg - you would never know. Location is fantastic - roll out of the hotel and into the Leidesplein for fun, food, drinks, shopping etc Everything you want on the doorstep and helpful, wonderful staff as well. Coffee was very welcome too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaBritain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in one of the rooms on the top floor of this hotel. The service was great; everyone on the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the city. There's a great free breakfast and the front desk offers discounts on some attractions. They also sell tickets for public transportation at the front desk. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends who are traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect clean hotel with friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: withoutstrings
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writing a hotel review and I'm only writing this becos I think that Hotel La Boheme is so good that I feel obliged to recommend it! :-) Firstly, the hotel staffs are so kind and friendly. It's my first time in Amsterdam and my first time travelling alone, I am a girl so it is only normal that I'll feel scared etc. But the hotel staffs made me feel very welcomed and at home! I don't know maybe all of their names but I remember Alice who is very helpful! She helped me check out the tour timings and the bus timings to the airport. Despite asking so many questions, she was still very patient and friendly! :-) Secondly, the room was very clean, even the toilet. They wash it everyday and it is really a very tidy hotel tuck just behind the Leidseplein station! It is only a 2min walk from the tram station which is very very very convenient! And Leidseplein is an excellent place to stay in as it is within the city centre but not as rowdy as the red light district! :-) I enjoyed my stay very much and would definitely return to the same hotel if I were to visit Amsterdam again :-) Thank you very much, Hotel La Boheme!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucie21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my cousin and a friend. We occupied a triple room. Basic but very clean. Just what you need for a few days break. The staff were fantastic. On our way to check in at the hotel I had my wallet stolen on the tram from Central Station, the staff were very upset by this and did everything they could to help. The breakfast was very good and one of the staff even sat with us and arranged an itinerary for us to visit several places using public transport, This was very much appreciated.There is also internet access. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: catnaps
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, it has no frills but excellent in many ways, perfect location, helpful and friendly staff, good breakfast and very clean. Near Leidsplein where you can find pubs, restaurants and entertainment and still very calm. Walking distance from museums, Vondelpark, Dam and 2 mn from the Tram. Being a solo traveler the staff made my stay very pleasant. The only downside is the noise coming from upstairs, i had a basement room, for a light sleeper it can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute we stayed at this wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZanielleS
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 4 days at the La Boheme, but it was great! The people were helpful and friendly. always smiling, chatting and laughing. We stayed on the top floor, and the stairs were tough, but worth it to get to our little hideaway room at the top, Breakfast was simple but hit the spot every morning and the coffee was delish! The location was in the mix after a 2 minute walk we were in the centre of Liedsplein... close to the canals, boat rides, food, drink.... everything. oh and the trams and buses were only a 2 minute walk too.... so easy to get to, and would reccommmend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: SiliconCellOut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on other reviews. It is a wonderful hotel, honestly located in a safe part of Amsterdam, yet very close to everything! All of the staff was very helpful and nice! I stayed two nights in room 2. It was very clean and cozy. I plan on staying here again, next time I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGeorge5
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff,good breakfast,perfect location..tram just 2 mins walking,behind the hotel all the pubs and restaurants, but however room was ok. And they didn't change the glasses upon cleaning the room. But the service of the staff made it all up.. Worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “BLOODY FANTASTIC!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redding23
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL WAS AMAZING!!!! Everthing about it was great the staff were lovely and so friendly and helpfull. The location is great walking distance from the red light district, anne franks house, Dam square, the musemums and the heineken experience. Bike and pedalo (pedal boat) hire are just round the corner as is the Volkspark a beautiful place to spend an afternoon. There is also numerous bars/clubs/restaurants near by but not so close that you can hear them at night. There is a tram stop down the road to get you to the central station or further afield.The hotel offers a tasty breakfast, a bar and fresh towels/ bed linen daily. I went with two friends and the room has more then big enough we had a fantasic time and the location and brillant staff made our trip. :) xxxxx

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Platero25
Reviews.Content: We are fully satisfied with the reception, cleaning, breakfast and the kindness of all staff and the valuable help on places to visit. Our stay was 10 nights Gianni and Gabriella ..............................................................................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “Great and just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: jgyk18
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 mates for 2 nights. Exactly what we wanted a cheap hotel in the middle of the going ons of the city. We came to Amsterdam to experience the nightlife, coffee shops bars and restaurants etc and we weren't disappointed within walking and tram distance of everything really. Good sized clean basic room with comfy beds. Bathroom was average but had nice warm shower. Friendly staff recommended places to go. The breakfast was a bit minimal but apart from that, it was GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “A stones throw from all the action!”
Reviews.Author: cdog22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the La Boheme hotel. Absolutely perfect for the restaurants and bars of Leitsplein, which is where most of the action is at night. We stayed in number 16 which was right at the top. Need to be fit if you are staying in that room (4 flights of stairs). This was not a problem for us as we like the exercise, but you may like to bear this in mind if booking and not so nimble on the old feet! The room was small but perfectly adequate for our needs as you are not there all day and it is only a base. Plenty of hot water and a self controlled radiator which is good if too hot or cold for you. Room spotless and cleaned every day. Breakfast was fine. Consisted of bread, cheese, meats, eggs, cereal, and fruit, juices, tea or coffee. Staff extremely friendly and would not hesitate to stay there again as it was so convenient and the staff great. The

Reviews.Title: “The best value accomodation we've stayed in.....wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ado22
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a smile and consideration after a long journey. The room was very clean with good storage areas. There was very little noise from the busy road or other guests who were generally younger than us. We enjoyed the selection of drinks available at the reception area and the free use of the hotel laptop. The hotel brochure was very informative and whatever it may not have covered, the very helpful staff would surely have obliged. The location of La Boheme is great for its closeness to all the attractions in and around Leidseplein, with only a short trip on the tram to Dam Sq and beyond, walking is fun too. As we left early in the morning, the staff arranged for us to take anything we needed for our breakfast up to our room the night before, very thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Ruxy90
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was really great,better than we had expected. The location is perfect,just around the corner starts the center,with bars and shops. The area is quiet,without problems( we came back at 3 o'clock and it was very safe). The rooms are normal,don't have great expectations-there are only 2 stars,not very big, the bathroom is a little bit small,but we had warm water non-stop,which was good. Still, the walls are very thin,for us wasn't a problem,but for a family with little children could be difficult. The breakfast was the same every morning,but you could find very good things to eat, even there was no diversity (they had juices,coffee,tee,marmelade,ham,cheese, boiled eggs,cookies). The staff is very kind,they helped us with everything we needed. This hotel is perfect for visiting amsterdam,especially for teenagers,and i strongly recomand it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaIan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location in the busy Leidseplein area, with easy access on foot or by tram to the rest of the city. The hotel staff are very friendly and welcoming. Rooms are fairly basic, but spotlessly clean. The hotel reception area also acts as a small breakfast room and bar. A perfect hotel for a trip with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine breakfast, very friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: Ralph039
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in Amsterdam and at the La Boheme hotel as well, a great place to be ! Above expectations. Will be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Deffinitly go back”
Reviews.Author: shellyo123
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at the La Boheme about a week before travelling it cost us 260 EUR / 216 GBP wich was slightly more expensive than the average 2 * that we had been looking at but as the reviews were so good we decided it was a saver option and worth the extra money (only about 30GBP more ). The day after we booked I recieved an email to let us know that they were doing some renovation work in the reception area on the 10th 11th and 12th so we would have to have breakfast across the street for the first 2 mornings , I wasn't really ahppy abotu this but thought it was nice that they let us know in advance , they also reasured me that there would not be any noice disterbance due to the renovations and there was not. The breakfast at the other hotel was not up to much which was a bit dissapointing , when we went to have breakfast on the third morning in our hotel they asked us what it had been like and were not happy that we wern't happy so they gave us a 20EUR disccount of out bill which was very nice of them and not at all expected we hadn't even complained really. The room was clean and supprisingly spacious considering what we were expecting from amsterdam hotels. Our bathroom was much bigger than expected as well and the Shower was nice and hot and powerfull . We were on the 4th floor up a lot of steep stairs but that is expected in Amsterdam . Overall the Hotel was perfect for waht we wanted , The rooms were clean and comfortable the bed was really comfy and the location was great right were all the pubs and resteraunts were but not noisy and a 5 min tram ride from dam square 15 mins to the zoo and 5 mins to the museums

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, sure we`ll stay here next time!!”
Reviews.Author: adibuddha
Reviews.Content: stuff is so friendly! We felt here as at home! location is amazing! around the corner of Hotel is the bus stop to airport, and there are some trams to Amsterdam Centraal. breakfast is good, price is the one of lowest in Amsterdam! We like this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hospitable staff, clean and well-lighted room, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Juliet06
Reviews.Content: Just a half-block from the Leidesplein, in an area with an abundance of coffee shops good things to eat. But you won't need to go out for breakfast, which comes with the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: possumTewkesbury
Reviews.Content: We pulled up outside and my heart sank. Very unprepossessing at first sight. However, staff very welcoming, helpful and friendly. \room very small but clean and quiet. Good breakfast too and owner gave us tips for sightseeing in northern Holland. Zaan Schanse and Alkmaar absolutelu brilliant - a real must for everyone. We loved them. Downside was having to Park and Ride as no parking nearby. We were charged both ways even though staff told us bus was free and it cost 12 euros not 6 as we were told. But even though Park and Ride area seemed dodgy the car was safe and secure. Overall I would say this is a hostel not a hotel but staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Jess186338
Reviews.Content: A very nice stay at this small hotel. It's very well located just off the Leidesplein centrally for all the main sights and with good transport links. Rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. Staff are lovely and helpful and the breakfast was good and lasted until 11am. Free WiFi was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality people, breakfast, information”
Reviews.Author: Kerricola
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the quality of the customer service. We felt warmly welcomed and were provided useful information about sights to see and services available in and around the city. The breakfast items were of good quality and plentiful. We would consider booking a different room next visit given to the king room on the 4th where we stayed. The stairs were indeed narrow, there was an odd bump down the middle of the bed and the awkward roof lines limited space in the room and bath.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: bigwillystyle79
Reviews.Content: The Hotel La Boheme is a basic hotel, with older furniture and decor in the rooms. It is however spotlessly clean, with friendly staff, nice breakfasts and a cat that you will want to put in your suitcase and take home. If you are new to Amsterdam, I strongly recommend the leidseplein area to stay, it has plenty of bars, clubs, restaurants, live music/comedy and of course coffee shops. It does not suffer from the chaos and seediness of the red light district, which i find great fun to visit, but would become annoying very quickly if i stayed there. We stayed in two double rooms on the top floor next to each other, the staff were kind enough to rearrange their room plan so that we could have adjacent rooms. Each of the rooms had it's own safe and bathroom The only real issue with this place is that the top floor rooms are accessible by stairs only, and the staircase is very narrow. If you are young and fit, this should pose no problem at all, but may cause issues if you have mobility problems. All in all, this has been one of the most enjoyable stays I have had in Amsterdam, give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very no frill room”
Reviews.Author: 2CanadianTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at la Boheme. We climbed 6 flights of steep stairs and 67 steps with our heavy luggage to our very basic room on the 4th floor, 80 euro a night. Washroom was okay. Breakfast adequate. Staff was exceptionally freindly and helpful. You can buy museum and Anne Frank's House tickets at the hotel to avoid long line-up at the door. The best value of this hotel is the location - a short walk to Leidseplein, the central district of Amsterdam where we shopped and ate supper. If you like Asian, we recommend Wok to Walk, very good noodle dishes and cheap. Panckae Bakery, the best in Amsterdam for traitional Dutch pancake, not far away from the West Church and Anne Frank's House. We had unlimited BBQ ribs for 12 euro at a sport bar in Leidseplein, great.value. Free wi-fi is available, no problem checking e-mail with my i-Pod Touch. No A/C, with the window shut, very quiet, with window open, you can hear the tram traffic noise on the street. Most guys can adapt to the no frills room of this hotel. If your wife wants something cozy and better, la Boheme is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modest, clean and very central Amsterdam lodging!”
Reviews.Author: 1966Stang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were very glad we did. The staff were extremely accomodating, friendly, and helpful. La boheme had everything we needed, but is not at all fancy. It was very clean, central and comfortable with our own bathroom (with a good shower). Nice complimentary breakfast in the morning, too! For those reviews which complain about the stairs: they're standard for the Netherlands. They weren't any problem for us at all. For a reasonable, no-frills, little hotel just off the Liedesplein, I wouldn't think to complain. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly accommodation in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTheGlobe
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I stayed here for 6 nights. We were looking for affordable accommodation near the Leidseplein, in order to minimize walking to many of the major sites (Dad has bad knees).
