The location of this hotel is great - off the plaza and away from the bustle, but still just a few minutes to the action on foot. It was very easy to catch trams and buses from this area, though it is quite a bit of getting used to when crossing the roads! I had stayed at Hotel Acro on a previous trip and expected that the rooms would be small and the stairs steep; this was certainly the case! The only issue we had with the room was that it was difficult to ventilate it when someone took a shower. Also, our room faced out the back of the hotel and there was some noise and cigarette smoke from the little shop below us. There are no screens in the windows, so you have to have them open to get any air in the room. The hotel staff (and the cat) were very friendly and helpful. :) The front desk even printed a train ticket for me free of charge. The free wifi was very reliable. The breakfast was pretty typical for Amsterdam and a little boring after a few days, but good to get you going. If you have to be somewhere early (before they start serving), be sure that you've picked up something the night before or have time to stop off at one of the bakeries for a sugary pastry, because nothing opens until around 9 or 10, not even McDonald's. This was my Dad's first overseas trip for pleasure and he was able to adjust to the different style of accommodation quite well, though I don't know that he'd volunteer to do it again! The steep, curvy stairs were tough for his knees (we asked for the lowest possible floor when we booked and this request was granted - the first floor is only single rooms with shared bathrooms). It was also not easy to lug a suitcase up and down the stairs with confidence. That said, I love Amsterdam and all its fun quirks and I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: philipkendall
Reviews.Content: our second stay at this hotel and my second review and as i stated last time.first class hotel,great location.staff always helpful and friendly.i have been given a discount for if i want to stay again so looks like i will be back.i would recommend this hotel to anybody without reserve.excellent value for money.i have stayed in cheaper hotels(with regret)and dearer ones but cant beat la boheme for value,cleanliness,and location

Reviews.Title: “Would be perfect if only not....”
Reviews.Author: A108034
Reviews.Content: ... happened that the first night we had to fight with a mouse in the room!!! The managers of the hotel were very sorry about this and explained that in Amsterdam a mouse in the room is not so uncommon due on how the houses in the old city are built. Now about the hotel. The managers are very friendly and ready to help with any information or advice. The breackfast is served aside the reception and has all that you may expect. As any house in the old Amsterdam as you enter the hotel there is a steep stair to go to the rooms and can be little challengin for people not in good shape, especially with suitcases. The rooms are not so wide but almost clean. The toilet was cleaned every day. The real plus of the hotel is the position. Near is a huge number of shops, restaurants and many tram lines to visit all the city. If not happened the mouse problem the first night I would rate this hotel 8/10.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so easy from airport, good breakfast, simple”
Reviews.Author: h3o
Reviews.Content: Cracking location just a stone's throw from Leidseplein. Friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was simple but good. Basic room but we wanted for nothing. We stayed in a double on the top floor - the stairs got easier but were a bit tricky! We had rucksacks but I wouldn't fancy lugging a suitcase there. Shame about noise from the renovation of the tramline but we needed to be up in time for breakfast so this was not a problem. I would recommend and it seemed to be even greater value for the 3 and 4 bed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location + absolutely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RadekM
Reviews.Content: We were really happy to pick this hotel. It had a convenient location (tram stop behind a corner) but we also walked to and from Centraal in about 10 minutes. Museums close, canal cruise stop two minutes away. Rooms small but cozy (we went to see Amsterdam city, not inside of hotel anyway :), and the staff was absolutely perfect. Helpful, smiling all the time, advising us.. we really enjoyed it. (And liked Mimi the cat, of course..)

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pitbullguppie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night with our three kids (21,18 and14) andhad two rooms for the five of us at a reasonable price. The people who worked there were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was better than we expected from the description "simple Dutch breakfast" and the rooms were nice and clean, apart from the smell of smoke in one of them. The location was just about ideal with the Leidseplein litterally just around the corner and yet not too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “good enough for me”
Reviews.Author: hotshowbag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as plan b , so it was a late booking and we were quite happy. The price was good , location great , breakfast very good , staff very good and easy to get to. Its away from the station but easy to get to from the train and airport . Lots of good food around at fair prices and a very busy night life .As others have said the stairs are a killer with luggage but that will happen in europe . I would stay again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Great Location, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: travel_chic_1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a typical Amsterdam budget hotel. Very steep narrow stairs, no elevator (which isn't a problem if you have few or small bags), small but clean room, and very friendly and accommodating staff. I booked a single room for 5 nites, and I had no complaints except for the people I had to share a bathroom with (next time I would be sure to get a private bathroom). Breakfast was good and consisted of toast, various spreads, cereal, cheese, deli meats, hard-boiled eggs, and coffee and orange juice. Reception, open until 11 pm, also had beverages and snacks available to purchase. There were several families, couples, and small groups of friends, as well as single travelers also staying in the hotel, so as long as you aren't incredibly picky, you will enjoy your stay just fine. You could definitley hear nite-noise, but it wasn't too bad for a major city. There was a laptop computer free to guests to use for 30 minutes at a time. Also, the location can't be beat--right around the corner from the Leidseplein, a major center of shops, restaurants, and the famed nightclub, Boom Chicago. Within walking distance of museums and almost everything, but I would probably take public transportation if getting there from Central Station. There is also a shuttle bus to the airport that stops just around the corner. Great budget stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Joana26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for people travelling with little luggage (no elevator) and who don't need more luxury than a friendly staff, free wireless internet and to be in a walking distance from everything. I stayed in the basemen and I had access to a quiet terrace in the back. It was good because in July the rooms to the street can be very hot and I felt really fresh in mine. And they cleaned my room everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Budget and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Kashaia
Reviews.Content: It was a very ok hotel as it is really near the Leidseplein which I love. The room was very small. The bed was ok but even with the windows closed we could hear a lot of noise. The bathroom is really poor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boris1951
Reviews.Content: Good location-we did't use city transport at all- Amsterdam's highlights were reached on foots Very friendly stuff, normal breakfast and room service. A very steep stairs but we lived on the first floor and don't fall once.Overall imression-very good

Reviews.Title: “convenience!”
Reviews.Author: hesti_10
Reviews.Content: this hostel located at great place, easy access & very center to most Amsterdam's interests places. Great for solo traveler!!! friendly & nice hotel staffs -which I prefer to call friends because they are so friendly. I will definitely stay in this hostel for my next adventure trip to Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, basic and clean with superb service”
Reviews.Author: dnf10
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely friendly and provided great service--we left before breakfast and they offered to bring a food tray to our room. Room was small, basic, no frills, but very clean. Soft mattress, but surprisingly comfortable. Warning about stairs--not recommended for the weak of heart or body. We had read about the stairs in previous reviews, and everything said was true. Hotel location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hostel”
Reviews.Author: emanuel_bcn
Reviews.Content: The strong points are: - Great location: very close to Leidseplein and bus stops that go to the airport. - Friendly staff: they are very attentive and a madam who was at the reception helped me a lot to solve a problem that I had with a luggage lost in the airport. The weak points are: - There is no elevator and the stairs are very, very steep. If you have physical disabilities or heavy luggage, it is almost impossible to reach the rooms upstairs. - The breakfast is very simple, with few options to choose. - Although we were advertised not to smoke on the rooms, we suspect that this is not followed by the guests, since the room had a kind of strange smell. - There was also a bed smell from the bathroom. The worst thing in our opinion was the toilet pan, whose "hole" was on the opposite position. I do not know if it is common in The Netherlands, but it is not functional and the result is disgusting! In summary, the hostel was just OK for us that wanted somewhere to sleep and did not have great expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Central, friendly and clean!”
Reviews.Author: TripperPete
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Amsterdam, in the middle of the Iceland volcano chaos! Originally planned to fly but ended up driving (via ferry) and the hotel were fantastic in recommending 24hr Park & Ride for the car, connecting trams to the hotel, and even local restaurants. Perfectly placed hotel, 2mins walk from Liedespleine and loads of bars, room basic, but very clean, well worth the reasonable price. Although very close to the lively square, hotel is just round the corner so no noise at all. Breakfast was fine. Friendly staff were always willing to help, cute and friendly cat too! Would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in a central area but not bang in the middle of the centre of town - town is only a leisurely 20 min stroll away. Only downside (some may say) is the steep stairs to the rooms, but it's Amsterdam, what do you expect?

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Vrooom
Reviews.Content: 2 blokes on a jolly for 2 nights, in Amsterdam without the wives....no not what you think! We were here for a gig at the Paradiso Club, and this hotel was a stone's throw away. All we wanted was a single bed each, a clean room with a bathroom big enough to move around in, a decent breakfast and pleasant conversation with the hotel staff. We got them all! No it's not 5 star, maybe a little basic, and I probably wouldn't stay here with my wife (though there were families there), but it was very clean, had a hot shower (which some 4/5 * hotels don't), good breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. Only two negatives were the stairs, they are very steep and probably wouldn't pass building regs in the UK, but as we were on the 3rd floor, it kept us fit and ensured we didn't drink too much! The other was the hotel opposite was being re-designed and the building site seemed to open at 6am, but obviously not a long-term issue. Given that Amsterdam is the most expensive place I've ever visited, this hotel was a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leeloominai
Reviews.Content: I've booked the hotel based on reviews I read here and did not make a mistake. The hotel was great, the rooms are basic but they were clean. We only needed the room to take a shower and to have a place to crash. We had the top floor room so we had to climb those steep stairs every day, but hey, that's Amsterdam :) The staff was very friendly and the location great, breakfast was also good. Would reccomend it and will visit again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “warm, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: abg112070
Reviews.Content: great staff ... everyone we met during our stay were warm, friendly and helpful ... always cheerful and smiling ... the rooms were basic but we were out most of the time and needed the room to sleep and have a shower ... our request prior to checking-in were dealt with ... excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: abcgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location for us. It was very close to the 9 little streets for shopping / strolling, and the main street for more shopping. It also has a couple of great bars next door - to have a drink before or after you head out for evening meals. The room was ideal for two friends sharing - very simple but had everything you need for a long weekend away. They were clean, warm and fresh towels were provided each day. More importantly, the beds were very comfortable! :) The stairs were steep but it wasn't a problem... Breakfast was more than adequate with toast, cereal, eggs and simple fruit provided... and fresh tea and coffee flowing. Finally, the staff were extremely friendly. Helped us find our way around the city, made suggestions etc. Free internet was a bonus, and they allowed us to print our flight boarding passes (which is a small thing but it makes a difference!). We were extremely pleased that we booked this hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chmcsouza
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days at La Boheme. The staff are very nice and helpfull. The bedrooms are clean (the beds could be larger...) and the breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a cozy little hotel perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: CrazyKitty81
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam with a friend of mine for my birthday last December. Had booked La Boheme cause my sister had stayed there a few years back and also based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. We knew it would be basic but chose it for its location. Staff was very friendly from the moment they answered my first mail. Both me and my friend never manage to travel light lol, so requested a room on the first floor, which we were allocated. Upon arrival, we were greeted at reception by a very friendly and professional lady and of course by the gorgeous cat :) We were able to get into our room straight away, even if we got there before their official check-in time. Room very basic, but again we were not expecting anything more; to be honest we didnt even expect it to be so clean or to have shower gel and all the toiletries - at the end of the day you get what you pay for. Couldnt hear any noise from where we were. After all it was a very pleasant stay at a very good value for an expensive city and we would be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Room wasn't great - but can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Vacat!on
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited in October. This hotel is located right in the heart of Leidseplein where all the restaurants and nightlife is. It was an easy bus ride from the airport to the hotel. The owners were very friendly - breakfast was served everyday (cereal, toast, etc). Our room was on the 3rd floor. We didn't expect the VERY steep and winding staircase. For those with big suitcases - be warned! The room was not as great as we expected. The room is older, but clean. There were some marks/stains on the wall. The bathroom had a musty/odd smell. Since we were only in town for a few days, we dealt with it. Free wi-fi which was useful. We woke up early every morning to the construction across the street. You really can't beat the location. There's tons of restaurants and cafes around. Make sure you go to Wok the Walk - great food! And Indonesian smorgasbord is popular there. Raw herring is definitely an experience. Anne Frank Haus is a definite must visit. And walking along canals with the visually appealing houses can be day trip on its own! We absolutely loved Amsterdam - would return again...but probably not to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GI_in_Germany
Reviews.Content: My wife, 6 year old daughter, and I stayed here for a few nights. The location is very central to many of Amsterdam's attractions, and the hotel is just around the corner from the tram stop. Also, there was a very good pizzeria right next door-great for a quick bite to eat! As for shopping, there are plenty of stores (including small grocery stores) near the tram stop. The staff were very friendly, and the breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Yes, the stairway is very steep, but we managed okay. There were no spectacular views (mainly construction across the street), but I found our room to be rather quiet. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “superfriendly place in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PeterFisher101
Reviews.Content: After a warm welcome, handy map and tips from the receptionist we had to climb the steep stairs to the top floor. Room small but cozy and clean. Nice buffet breakfast untill 11.00 which is good, because we had some great nights out. (just around the corner in the bars around the Leidse Plein and to the fantastic club Melkweg- what an athmosphere). Wonderful city with al these local people on bikes! Personell was extremely helpful, which made the stay very special.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam in October”
Reviews.Author: AK_Adam
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the staff was friendly and accomodating. Good breakfast included in room price. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: philipkendall
Reviews.Content: Been to amsterdam many times and first time stayed here.great location,clean,friendly staff,great hotel and good value for money.would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Place. EXCELLENT Location.”
Reviews.Author: Fluorescence
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week in one of the single rooms. It's in the basement and 3 rooms share a common bathroom & shower. The rooms are decent and well equipped - very cozy. The shower and toilet are extremely small though clean. The room has a safe, TV, phone & AC/Heater. It overlooks the backyard where you can smoke. The breakfast is nice & delicious bt repetitive. The owner is the sweet and helpful and can store your luggage. The best part about the hotel is the location. It's at Leidseplein and a direct bus is available for the airport and also its right net tot he tram stop. Its a 2 minute walk from the museum square. Stay here for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: roadman1122
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in a single downstairs, with a shared bathroom. Simple yet pleasant accomodations, with a window that looked out to an enclosed courtyard. Since it faced the back, I was not aware of any construction noise. The breakfast is exactly what had been described in other reviews, so i knew what I was getting. I thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast area and the food- it was just right. The staff is really what made me feel at home here. At check-in, they were very informative. At breakfast, they were very friendly and went on line to give me a weather report for the day. And at check-out, they made sure I had all the information I needed to catch my bus to Paris. They also held my backpack all that last day so I could see the Van Gogh museum unencumbered and catch my last sights of this wonderful city. That was a great value to me. I chose it for the location and loved it for the people. I certainly missed the English-speaking staff when i got to Paris. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: inelusha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights on a short vacation. Very nice people welcomed us before even getting to Amsterdam. They explained in detail how we can reach them from the airport and it only took us 45 minutes to get there from the airport. We had a twin room and it was pretty confortable, maybe a bit too little. When we arrived, the beds were spread against facing walls and the bathroom door wouldn't open entirely, but we moved to beds toghether near each other and we solved the problem. Breakfast was pretty much ok, not very varied but there were boiled eggs, a toaster, 2 types of cheese and 2 types of ham, honey, chocklate and peanuts cream, butter, yoghurt, cold milk, cereals (3 types), 2 types of juice...and this would be it. They also offered tea and coffee. The coffee was particularly tasty. They offered us a city map, general information about the city, very nice people who answered to whatever question we had. We has to give a 20 Euro deposit for the room-key, which they returned to us the day before we left. The room was pretty clean, they changed the towels every day and they vaccuumed the room once while we were there. We also borrowed from them bookd to read and a chess board. There is a hotel under construction right in front of the hotel, but we were not bothered at all by noice or on the street. There is also a tram crossing in front of the hotel...but we were also not disturbed by the noise. What we didn't like: - they have a cat at the reception...and it may also walk on the tables where you eat your breakfast; - the new towels were put on the floor before they were brought into the room; - the window wouldn't close properly, so the air in the room was "naturally" refreshed. But there was a proper heater in the room so the temperature was ok, we could stay in t-shirts with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissRobinS
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at La Boheme in Amsterdam. We arrived very early in the morning on our flight from the US and the hotel quickly got our room ready for us and let us check in very early. The room was clean and the staff during our stay was very friendly. We loved the breakfast with hard-boiled eggs, great coffee, and deli meats and cheeses. Our first night, we were near the side of the hotel where construction was occuring across the street, but it did not bother me much (but my fiance had a little trouble sleeping in the morning once they began). We loved being able to walk to Leidensplein, a main square in the city, and we walked to all other areas of interest including the Van Gogh Museaum, the Red Light District and great places to eat as well. We were able to take trams to other places like the Ann Frank house, and even able to take a very affordable bus directly outside the hotel right to he airport, which was terrific! We liked the hotel so much that we re-booked it for the tail-end of our trip almost 4 weeks later and they were equally as accomodating and friendly as in the beginning of our trip. We really enjoyed it there and will surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Bravo_Plantation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Boheme for five nights earlier this month and have to say that it was a very good hotel. The room was very clean and had an en-suite bathroom. The staff at the hotel were very courtious and helpful as well. The location of the hotel is excellent too as it is located just around the corner to the Leidseplein which is one of the main areas of nightlife in Amsterdam. Overall I was very impressed and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: DaisyMalu
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Boheme is a great place to stay for budget travellers. It is exactly as I expected and I was very pleased to find that to be the case -- everyone there is very friendly and helpful, the hotel is in a fabulous location, the free breakfast is just right. Watch out for those Dutch stairs though! OMG... There is some construction right now across the street, but it really didn't bother me very much - I know my husband was woken up a few times -- might be best to request a room in the back for now. Location as I said it great - just down the street from the Leidseplein and w/in walking distance to many sights. And be sure to say hello to the adorable resident kitty!!

Reviews.Title: “La boheme was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry42
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend both stayed in la boheme for three nights and it was a really good experience. The hotel itself is pretty small and yes the stairs are quite steep....not a problem as the cleaners will happily carry your stuff up to your room if needed. The room we had was very clean and with enough room to move. Showeroom was small but that is all we needed and it was cleaned everyday with fresh towels. Breakfast was really good and was not too early so perfect after a late night out! Tea and coffee included! The locaton was amazing just down from the melkweg (one of the main nightclubs in the dam) also just off an area with a lot of food places and bars which are a little bit expensive, however walk to the outter parts of amsterdam and you will be sure to find cheaper beer and food (local places!!) Other reviews have mentioned construction work.....yes there is a construction site across the road and our room was overlooking it but it was not that noisy and did not disturb us at all. Most noise comes from trams but they are pretty much everywhere! So overall a great stay with very helpful and friendly staff and i would definetely reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “If you like jackhammering at 7:00 AM and back pains, stay here”
Reviews.Author: forrestlsmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the single rooms downstairs. The room was small with a sink in the corner. At first glance, it looked ok. A bit dumpy, but I had a doorway to a patio out the back of my room, so it didn't seem that bad. Then I got in bed. I didn't realize I had to bring my own sheets and pillow case to a hotel with me. Everything felt really dirty and sleeping was awful without the proper linens. I mean, who wants to share a pillow with a thousand other guests that have gone to Amsterdam to stay on the cheap? I used a towel for the pillow, but had nothing for a sheet. And the bed was really uncomfortable. A month and a half later and my back still hurts. I'm tall, but the giant hole from years of use in the middle of the mattress did me no favors. On top of that, jackhammering started every morning around 7:00. I couldn't believe how early they were working. Being in the basement, the sound of jackhammering next door really goes straight to your head. It appeared like this construction would be going on for quite some time from what I could tell. The location was fine, but is there a bad location to stay in this city? On on a positive note, the shared bathroom was kept clean and the hotel staff were friendly and provided a little European breakfast with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: chriskargbo
Reviews.Content: I've been to amsterdam three times overy the years and have stayed at la boheme each time. now......la boheme isn't luxury(there's a time and a place for posh hotels), but it's clean, rates are reasonable & it's in a great location. the staff are very friendly too in that not in your face at every corner way, which can be annoying. they've even got a nice cat who i love to hang out with in the lobby area. i'm not too sure when i'll be going back to amsterdam, but when i do, i'll definitely be staying at la boheme.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: lake245
Reviews.Content: Our first night there, we found a mouse in our hotel room. The next morning, the staff blamed it on the construction going on outside the hotel. Speaking of the construction, it is loud and begins at 7 am every morning. Hotel room hot so had to leave open windows which meant flies coming into the room and then getting woken up by the massive construction equipment across the street. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, which is why I pushed it up from 1 to 2 stars. Right in Leidsplein, a major center of nightlife in Amsterdam. I know it is a small place, but also found the breakfast to be weak as well.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Savour”
Reviews.Author: fazzy43
Reviews.Content: Spent 2-3 days in total in Holland without really planning or organising accommodation or activities as it was a last minute thing. It was not until i actually got to Amsterdam that i booked the accommodation online. It was the more costly of 2 options available to me but i went with it and within the hour i was there and checked in with no problems. The hotel itself is in a great location right beside the 'Leidseplein' which everyone knows off and is full the widest range of food resturants i've ever seen. The staff are extremely helpful and really friendly, i even seen them happy to allow a traveler to leave luggage for a week while they went to another country. Room was clean enough though a bit plainly decorated but had all bases covered plus, sink, wardrobe, cable tv for when your wanting a rest from all the sight seeing etc. Breakfast is included and was pleasant enough, it helps that it is served up till 11 and you can eat as much as you like!! Overall, room was average, breakfast was good but the friendly staff i delt with made all the difference

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget in Dam”
Reviews.Author: tenesmus
Reviews.Content: I found the La Boheme a very enjoyable place to stay during recent short break in Amsterdam. I had one of the single rooms in the basement, which was clean and a decent enough size. Because it was situated in the back of the hotel there was no noise at night (although the hotel does appear to be surrounded by several building sites on the Marnixstraat, most of whom start work just after 7am!). The breakfast was functional and the staff were courteous and always willing to help. Compared to other hotels I experienced in Amsterdam La Boheme offers a pleasant and civilised experience for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: Sharon30
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be the best hotel, actually it's pretty basic but its positioning is excellent. Easy to get to from the airport and situated in one of the best areas of Amsterdam, all attractions within short walking distance. Staff were friendly and rooms clean, but it's Amsterdam so what does it matter, it's not about the room it's about the freedom and experience. Trying however to climb the spiral stairs after quite a few smokes, not easy!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it, great location, tiny room, Very friendly staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: starhead
Reviews.Content: The hotel web site is very accurate, so give it a look. TINY room and very small beds by American standards, but you don't come to Amsterdam to spend time in the room. You just can't beat the location right on the Leidesplein behind the Melkweg. Just make sure you ask for an extra blanket as the one on the bed is quite small. The staff is so friendly, just ask for anything and they'll show you where to go. You'll want an unlimited tram pass as its real easy to jump on to get anywhere. Is this a 5 star hotel, not by any means, but its quiet, safe, friendly, and very convenient to get to. I'd stay there again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “really good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: wigster
Reviews.Content: an excellent budget hotel in a great location. for the price it was well worth it. we had a triple room with ensuite.. no problems what so ever... you will get value for your money with this hotel... i have stayed in some right holes in Amsterdam & paid more for the priviledge!! i was happy to come back to this hotel after some hardcore coffeshops! take it easy everyone,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, central, but slightly worn”
Reviews.Author: Salsannie
Reviews.Content: On arriving at La Boheme we had the distinct impression that the place was not quiet all it was cracked up to be based on previous reviews! A lick of paint and a good carpet clean would probably have done the trick to the allay our instinctive negative reactions. But we were warmly welcomed by the staff who were extremely friendly and more than willing to offer advice about tours/, transport and sights. This made all the difference. Our room was okay but the carpet could have done with a good clean. The place was surprising quiet given its location, but one night i found it difficult to sleep with the wafts of smoke coming from a smoker in the room opposite (which gently wafted under our door towards me!) Breakfast was good, and there was no presssure to be out at the allocated time of 11am. Overall, probably a good option for young budget travellers, but for me i'd probably pay a few quid extra the next time and stay somewhere that i could really chill out and feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: BrownEyeGirl88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel La Boheme for 4 nights in early June 2005 based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. Amsterdam is a very expensive place to stay so we considered the rate at La Boheme of 100Euro/night including breakfast to be a decent deal. The hotel has a great location right near Leidsplein - it is very central and every major sight in Amsterdam is no more than a 25m walk and there is a tram system too. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The actual room (we had a twin room) was small and very basic, but clean and adequate. The bathroom is very small, but having a proper shower stall made it fine for us. It is important to note (and this was mentioned in many of the prior reviews) that the hotel has NO ELEVATOR and VERY STEEP AND NARROW STAIRS. Anyone planning to stay here needs to pack light and be able to haul their luggage up the stairs. This is NOT the place for the elderly or heavy travellers. Overall, we had a pleasant stay at La Boheme and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay - would give 3.5 but not quite 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Mangotree42
Reviews.Content: Considering that everything seemed expensive when travelling on the Canadian dollar in Europe, this hotel was decent enough for the (relative) price. There's no disguising La Boheme as anything other than a standard, good 2-star hotel, with it's slightly lumpy (and TINY) cot-like beds, walls and ceiling that could do with a fresh coat of paint (though somehow after 1 night the faint rust coloured water marks seemed to disappear and blend in) and smell of stale smoke that permeated the hallways. The location near Leidsplein was excellent, the bathroom clean with a nice hot shower and a cozy reception area to start the day with a breakfast of toast, cheese, deli meats, eggs, juice and tea. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. Don't expect any hidden gem here or unexpected frills, but a a decent value-for-money stay in a seemingly safe and well located 2-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, everything's OK with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bassosoolo
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights last February there. What I really liked was the location: just a minute walk from the lively Leidseplein. I stayed at single room, a tiny room but clean, three persons share wc and shower but that was pretty ok for a hotel of that price range. (I paid 135 â‚¬ for three nights, I guess it was a off-season bargain). I think I'll stay at the same other next time I vist A'dam.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: koka982
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff!!!Nice hotel, very clean!!!Well located!!!I can recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: oatis3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days over Thanksgiving and everything about the hotel was fabulous. It is in a great area(everything is within 10 minutes walk), it is spotless, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Wardo13
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through this site after trying to find a reasonably priced hotel in Amsterdam for a weekend away. This was the only one I came across without negative reviews. La Boheme offers what most people want from this type of hotel - friendly helpful staff, clean, quiet, good location and value for money. Ideal for a few nights in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4-night stay. Small hotel, we were in room 17 which was right at the top of 4 very steep flights of stairs. Other than that, the room was clean, well-lit with good facilities. Continental breakfast was very nice (cereals, breads, cold meats, boiled eggs, cheese). Very good location just off the leidesplein. Great hotel if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great helpful staff, quiet, clean, central location”
Reviews.Author: pigtailsPEI
Reviews.Content: Spend three days at La Boheme with the girls. Staff were super, very helpful. Got all the information we needed from the staff and therefore didn't have to pay for a city map. Got a great restaurant recommendation 'Casa Peru' from the staff. Location is super for nightlife and having access to bicylces, shopping, canal cruises etc... City bus from the airport goes almost to the door (across the street at the Hotel American). No surprizes in terms of the hotel quality as I checked out reviews at tripadvisory. The hotel was fine, clean, secure rooms, great showers, very soft beds. I was impressed with how quiet the hotel was and loved the wall mural outside our window. Breakfasts had something for everyone - great atmosphere in the bar - tea/coffee and juice service by staff made it feel less like self-serve and little more like you splurged at a restaurant. Stairs were steep but they all must be as I have never seen a city with so many people on crutches

Reviews.Title: “Clean & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very clean rooms with everything you need. Staff are friendly and helpful, in a great location in the centre of Liedsplein. Cannot complain about price, very cheap for what you get, only the very steep stairs let the hotel down, not suitable for people with walking difficulties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel If You R On A Budget”
Reviews.Author: Belfasttravellers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I really enjoyed our stay in this little hotel. La Boheme, like most other hotels in Amsterdam, was very compact. Our twin room with a bathroom was exceptionally clean. There was hot water, a great shower and comfortable beds. Our room was at the back of the hotel overlooking the back yard. The hotel is very quite at night. This is a budget hotel, so don't expect frills like air conditioning or free shampoo and toothpaste! You can borrow a hairdryer or iron from the reception staff, who are friendly and approachable. The breakfast served is basic: coffee, bread, cheese and hard-boiled eggs. La Boheme is a 25 minute walk from the Train Station (5 minutes in the tram). It is in a central and safe location (facing the Hotel Americian). If you are going to Amsterdam, you're going to be spending most of your time sightseeing in the city. Your hotel will only be someplace to crash at night! We would both recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oooooh yea”
Reviews.Author: omarco
Reviews.Content: Booked a triple room for 3 nights in January. The room and hotel in general is very clean. It is 2 minutes walk from Leidseplein Square which is busy day and night. Small bar/reception on ground floor.No lift and steep stairs so not suitable for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: hannah23
Reviews.Content: We went to stay in Hotel La Boheme for 5 nights. We were three girls and the room was nice and clean even though a little small (but we didn't go to Amsterdam to stay in our room!). The staff were friendly and really helpful. I'd stay there for sure if I go again with friends...

Reviews.Title: “Best Leidseplein small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great weekend we had in Amsterdam. Our accommodation was really comfortable clean and the beds were something else, if we could have brought those mattresses home we would have done. Staff friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend you not just for the service we received but the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Boheme was everything you'd want. Is in excellent location for both day and nightlife! Small, clean and very friendly. Room was plain but comfortable and clean. Would, in fact have, recommended it to friends. Will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: La bohÃ¨me is a small hotel, nevertheless it is very cosy and warm. Loved my stay there : clean towels and a made bed every day, nice rooms with tv and a great and copious breakfast. The staff is very nice and helpful ! Absolutely worth a stay !

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at La Boheme”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at la boheme, the staff are very helpful and friendly, the room was very clean with good day to day change of towels/sheets, the hotel is very central but quiet at nights, we recommend la boheme and will be coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Another Trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Boheme in early April 2003.Nice small Hotel. Staff very friendly and very helpful.Close to Leidsplein, Popular night (and day) spot.Street side rooms can be a little noisey day and night (friday and sat nights). Trams/ buses/cars and of course bicycles make up the traffic on the street. But these are the sounds of the city.La Boheme is in a good centralized location for walking tours of Amsterdam.The rooms are a little plain in decor, but I don't go to Amsterdam to look at pretty curtains.Next time I go to Amsterdam I would consider staying at the La Boheme again.Just keep in mind this is a 2 star hotel not a 5 star. I have no problems recommending this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Boheme
HotelInfo.Address: Marnixstraat 415, Amsterdam 1017 PK, The Netherlands
